channel.title: Need to clean the hard drive on old computer and put something new on
channel.description:
I have a desktop that is pretty old and runs decently slow from just getting a lot of use over time. I want to start using it again to run some stuff and save me some money so I don't have to buy a new desktop.
I need some information about how I do this. Google was no help.
I was wondering if there is a way I could torrent windows 7 and then put it on a flash drive and load it up onto the desktop and just clean the hard drive and install the new software and make the computer run fresh like it was brand new.
Also, the computer was windows XP so probably getting a new copy of that would work better than windows 7. I'm not sure if putting newer software would mess it up.

item.title: Need to clean the hard drive on old computer and put something new on
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

I vote you get a copy of Window’s Millennium. It will run faster then almost any of the newer operating systems on a low spec computer, because it doesn’t come preloaded with all the shit that Window’s 7, Xp, and Vista do.

Read full topic
item.source: Need to clean the hard drive on old computer and put something new on

item.title: Need to clean the hard drive on old computer and put something new on
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Marcbob you should just leave your operating system as windows xp if possible because you have already stated that the computer is slow. And if you upgraded to Windows 7 it’s just gonna make it even slower because more features from windows 7 and ram space taken up, etc… to run that version of windows. Also, if your gonna reformat it back to windows xp you would need the installation disk or at start up you could try holding down F8 and go through the recovery options to reset everything to factory settings. In addition, if you torrent its not even worth doing unless there is a product key that came with it for that version of windows 7, that would activate it.

Read full topic
item.source: Need to clean the hard drive on old computer and put something new on

item.title: Need to clean the hard drive on old computer and put something new on
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:1, topic:442631”]I was wondering if there is a way I could torrent windows 7 and then put it on a flash drive and load it up onto the desktop and just clean the hard drive and install the new software and make the computer run fresh like it was brand new.

Also, the computer was windows XP so probably getting a new copy of that would work better than windows 7. I’m not sure if putting newer software would mess it up.[/quote]
1> There are official download links.
http://www.mydigitallife.info/download-windows-7-iso-official-32-bit-and-64-bit-direct-download-links/

2> I have Win7 on an old dell laptop and it responds better than its previous WinXP installation. The worst possible thing that could happen is you need to download drivers.

Read full topic
item.source: Need to clean the hard drive on old computer and put something new on

item.title: Need to clean the hard drive on old computer and put something new on
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

marcbob:

If I am going to format the computer and lose everything, will I need to have a CD with windows xp on it ready to go? Because this computer never came with a software disk or anything. I’ll have to figure out how to load a CD with it on.

Read full topic

item.title: Need to clean the hard drive on old computer and put something new on
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

If you don’t mind the look and don’t need to run newer programs or anything that uses .NET 3.5+, use Windows 2000. Else, go with XP. Never put Vista or higher on an older computer.

Read full topic

Most linux distros come with a GUI for installing and are made to make things very easy, so you should have little problems when installing it, windows also has a good GUI is pretty much made to do most of the work for you just a little click here and their a little typing and done…
